examples: You got three answers right and two wrong.

definitions.definition: If you are right about something or someone, you are correct in your judgment or statement about it, him, or her:
examples: You were right about Pete - he's a real troublemaker.

definitions.definition: on or towards the side of your body that is to the east when you are facing north:
examples: Turn/Go right (= take the road on the right) at the first traffic lights.
I've got a pimple right on the end of my nose.
The car ran right (= completely) out of fuel.
English is written and read from left to right.

definitions.definition: used to express agreement with someone or to show that you have understood what someone has said:
said when you want to make a group of people notice you, especially so that you can start an activity:
examples: Right, everyone. Could you all stop talking, and then we'll begin.

definitions.definition: said between parts of a story that you are telling, in order to make certain that people are paying attention and understanding:
examples: So there I was right, middle of the night, right, and this guy came up to me...

definitions.definition: If you right a situation or a mistake, you make it better or correct it:
examples: It's a terrible situation and we should right it as soon as possible.

definitions.definition: If a boat rights itself, it turns itself back to its correct position in the water:
examples: The canoe will right itself if it capsizes.
